intro: Roureopsis pinnata, commonly known as the veined sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
